sub_title: Independent consultant and associate partner Ecorys
summary:
Mr Rob Jeuring graduated at the University of Amsterdam in 1986 in the field of city planning with specialisation traffic and mobility. He was co-founder of AVM 29 years ago which was integrated in ECORYS Netherlands in 2001. He is now independent consultant and associate partner of ECORYS Netherlands. He has 31 years of professional experience in research and policy projects in the field of sustainable urban transport and mobility. He worked for clients in the private and public sector as well as for NGO’s on a local/ regional, national and international level.

He has been or is working on various EU funded projects in this field, including KITE, LINK, SUGRE and PROCEED, ELTIS, European City Pass for Low Emission Zones and was involved in the impact assessments for the EU Urban Mobility Action Plan in 2008, as well as the Urban Mobility Package 2013. In 2012 he assisted the Euro2012 agency in Ukraine with transport anu mobility planning. From 2013 till 2015 he was secreatriat of the European Platform on Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans, as part of his activities for Eltis, the  urban mobility observatory.
He assisted the European Commission's efforts to support sustainable urban mobility in EU partner countries by organising seminars and studytours. He is currently also working for several clients in the Netherlands like the muncipality of Amsterdam on parking issues in the Amsterdam ArenA Stadium area.

Specialisations: Sustainable Urban Transport and Mobility with thematic specialisations: on and off street parking, local public transport, intermodality, mobility management.

education.field_of_study: Urban and Regional Planning, specialisation traffic and transport

contributors.headline: Independent consultant and associate partner Ecorys

projects.title: Handbook safe and secure intermodal passenger transport
projects.description:
Aim of the handbook is to assist local authorities, architects, city planners and public transport companies with the design and maintenance of safe and secure (passenger) transport routes from door to door. The handbook looks at all the elements of the (passenger) transport chain like bus stops, railway stations, walking and cycling routes, parking garages and P+R facilities.

Client: CROW, the Dutch knowledge centre on transport and mobility

contributors.headline: Independent consultant and associate partner Ecorys

projects.title: Support to sustainable urban mobility in EU partner countries
projects.description: Technical assistance to the European Commission's efforts to support sustainable urban mobility in EU partner countries and in particular in China: preparing resource packs, organising seminars, trainings and study tours. Two 10-days EU Urban Mobility and Air Quality study tours for Chinese high level  stakeholders were conducted in 2015/2016, as well as seminars on sustainable urban mobility in Brussels and Istanbul and contribution to the CIVITAS Forum 2015. An EU study tour for US participants on urban logistics was conducted in September 2016.  Client: European Commission, DG Move

projects.title: Managing and developing the Eltis portal and supporting the uptake of Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans in Europe.
projects.description:
Partner in a consortium for managing and developing the Eltis portal and supporting the uptake of Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans in Europe 

Tasks: 
* Supporting the uptake of Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans (SUMP's) in European cities. Case studies Eltis portal (http://www.eltis.org/)
* Improvement and integration plan of the Mobilty Plans portal
* Seminars on SUMPs
* Helpdesk Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans 
* Secretariat of the European Platform  on Sustainable Urban Transport Plans.  

client: European Commission, Executive Agency for Competitiveness and Innovation

projects.title: PROCEED High Quality Local (Bus) Transport
projects.description:
PROCEED High Quality Local Bus Transport project; The EU-project PROCEED exploit both latest R&D expertise and also the experience from transport  operators and linked business and in particular RTD-projects both of national and international type. PROCEED transformed this knowledge into a knowledge base and set up guidelines and tool to support planners, educators and practitioners involved in urban public transport in small and medium sized cities.

Client: European Commission

contributors.headline: Independent consultant and associate partner Ecorys

projects.title: KITE and LINK
projects.description:
‘Last uban mile’ consultant in the EU projects Kite and Link aiming to provide respectively a knowledge base and a platform on intermodal travel in Europe. The Kite Knowledge Base comprises all relevant information about passenger intermodality, including the last urban mile.

Client: European Commission

contributors.headline: Independent consultant and associate partner Ecorys

projects.title: SUGRE (sustainable green fleets)
projects.description:
The EU-project SUGRE (Sustainable Green Fleets) focused on the dissemination of  experiences and good practices in relation to alternative fuels and alternatively propelled vehicles (AF&APV). Target groups were fleet owners, authorities, driving schools, public transport organisations and individual drivers. 
Responsibility: Work package state of the art of policies, projects and results in the field of alternative fuels and alternatively propelled vehicles (Europe and abroad).
Client: European Commission
